title: Aggregate metadata (dicom) stumbles upon some unicode issue without traceback
body:
#### What is the problem?
As reported by @cni-md, `aggregate-metadata` fails on a DICOM dataset with an unicode related issue. Reproduced it with more detailed logging. Sadly, we don't get any useful traceback by the logs - it throws up all the way to main.py before it gets logged.

```
[INFO   ] datalad:8>main:359>interface.base:432>utils:408,475>aggregate:690,198>metadata:411  Engage metadata extractors: ['datalad_core', 'dicom']
[INFO   ] datalad:8>main:359>interface.base:432>utils:408,475>aggregate:690,198>metadata:437>dicom:61  Attempting to extract DICOM metadata from 11396 files
[DEBUG  ] datalad:8>main:359>interface.base:432>utils:408,475>aggregate:690,236>dataset:437>utils:322  Determined class of decorated function: <class 'datalad.interface.unlock.Unlock'>
[DEBUG  ] ...>utils:475>aggregate:690,236>dataset:437>utils:463,451,408,475>unlock:91>utils:322  Determined class of decorated function: <class 'datalad.interface.annotate_paths.AnnotatePaths'>
[DEBUG  ] ...>interface.base:432>utils:408,475>aggregate:690,236>dataset:437>utils:463,451,408,505  not controlled by annex, nothing to unlock [unlock(/home/bpoldrack/scratch/test2/utf8-session/dicoms/.datalad/metadata/objects/d8/ds-c87983928f4268a24922883d65be8c)]
[ERROR  ] datalad:8>main:389  'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xb0 in position 0: invalid start byte [utf_8.py:decode:16] (UnicodeDecodeError)
```

However, I ran it via python API (PY2) and got:

```
[INFO   ] Attempting to extract DICOM metadata from 11396 files
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/distribution/dataset.py", line 437, in apply_func
    return f(**kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 463, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 451, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 408, in generator_func
    result_renderer, result_xfm, _result_filter, **_kwargs):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 475, in _process_results
    for res in results:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/metadata/aggregate.py", line 690, in __call__
    to_save)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/metadata/aggregate.py", line 243, in _extract_metadata
    store(meta, objpath)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/support/json_py.py", line 53, in dump
    return dump2fileobj(obj, f)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/support/json_py.py", line 60, in dump2fileobj
    **json_dump_kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/__init__.py", line 278, in dump
    for chunk in iterable:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/encoder.py", line 678, in _iterencode
    for chunk in _iterencode_dict(o, _current_indent_level):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/encoder.py", line 635, in _iterencode_dict
    for chunk in chunks:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/encoder.py", line 635, in _iterencode_dict
    for chunk in chunks:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/encoder.py", line 515, in _iterencode_list
    for chunk in chunks:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/encoder.py", line 635, in _iterencode_dict
    for chunk in chunks:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/encoder.py", line 482, in _iterencode_list
    yield buf + _encoder(value)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/simplejson/encoder.py", line 54, in encode_basestring
    s = s.decode('utf-8')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/encodings/utf_8.py", line 16, in decode
    return codecs.utf_8_decode(input, errors, True)
```

To be continued ...
